review.content:
Puistossa is a song that is written as a story, and it tells the story of two young people, Pete (Petri Ruusunen) and Laura, who are both struggling in life in different ways. It is inspired by the song "Atlantic City" by Bruce Springsteen.

Story

Pete is a 16-year-old who has a troubled family life and is now addicted to heroin and cigarettes. Laura is a woman who went to business school to start her own business, only to eventually go bankrupt. Her parents refuse to help her, telling her "Tervetuloa maailmaan" (Welcome to the real world). Laura and Pete meet up at the park (hence the song name, Puistossa, which means 'at the park'), to rob Laura's parents. They escape on Laura's motorcycle, nearly escaping the police. Finally, the song ends with the chorus repeated for the third time, essentially stating that no matter what happens, the world keeps moving, and everything dies at some point.

Music/Instrumentation

Musically, the song is an acoustic-driven early 2000s Finnish pop-rock song, composed of acoustic/electric guitar, drums, keyboards/synths/effects, and bass (as far as I can tell - there is limited info online; I was able to find on his Q&A pages that he borrowed a bass from Jan-Olof Strandberg for Puistossa, but not much else). The song is melancholic but catchy, and the main theme is somewhere between reflective/contemplative and fatalistic - the song, especially the chorus, gives the impression that bad events can't be changed or avoided (fatalism) but the overall vibe of the song is more like "Yeah, this is just what life is, but that doesn't mean it won't get better." The lack of a conclusion—besides Pete and Laura stealing the jewelry—reinforces this. It just has that sort of hopeful tone to it, despite the lyrics. I don't think Kela would have made it so upbeat and catchy if it wasn't meant to be interpreted like this. Personally, I think the lyrics are very well-written and tell the story of Pete and Laura excellently, despite Kela stating that he's always thought that the lyrics could have been written better. However, to be a little bit critical, I've always felt that the lyrics lacked any sort of conclusion and were a bit repetitive, and although the lack of an ending leaves it open to interpretation, I think songs written in a storytelling style are usually better with a more obvious final takeaway and conclusion.

Overall

Overall, I think Puistossa is a great song, and one of the best songs on the *Nummela* album and in Anssi Kela's entire discography. It's a well-written song by an incredibly talented artist, and I highly recommend it to anyone, whether you know Finnish or not!

lyrics.content:
Verse

Puistossa ilta viilenee Pete lämpimikseen hyppelee Kelloaan katsoo kiroillen Sytyttää röökin viimeisen Luokan priimus oli koulussa Nyt kuudentoista, koniin koukussa Eikä mutsi jaksa välittää Faijaansa ei oo nähnytkään Pete pitää huolen itsestään Eilen sai viestin frendiltään "Nyt ois helpot massit tiedossa Jos tuut mukaan, nähdään puistossa" Pete pystyyn nostaa kaulukset Ja kiskoo sauhut viimeiset Vielä kerran miettii mielessään Ei oo mitään menetettävää

Chorus

Maailma matkaa radallaan Päivä nousee uudestaan Ei mikään muutu milloinkaan Kaikki säilyy ennallaan Samat tuulet puhaltaa Samat sateet lankeaa Ja kaikki kaunis katoaa Kaikki kuolee aikanaan

Verse

Kaunis nuori nainen Laura on Käytyään kauppaopiston Päätti oman firman perustaa Haki ison lainan pankistaan Mutta Laura joutuu vaikeuksiin Ajettiin firma konkurssiin Nyt selviä ei laskuistaan Lainasta puhumattakaan Sen vanhemmilla rahaa riittäis Mut ne ei haluu auttaa tytärtään Ne sanoo, "Tervetuloa maailmaan Täällä pärjätä saa omillaan" Laura valvoo yönsä rukoillen "Luoja auta, selviä en"

Chorus

Maailma matkaa radallaan Päivä nousee uudestaan Ei mikään muutu milloinkaan Kaikki säilyy ennallaan Samat tuulet puhaltaa Samat sateet lankeaa Ja kaikki kaunis katoaa Kaikki kuolee aikanaan

Verse

Laura saapuu prätkällään Sen puiston laitaan pysäyttää Pete nousee taakse istumaan Kumpikaan ei sano sanaakaan Ja he ajavat pihaan huvilan Laura avaimensa ojentaa Ja Peteä vielä muistuttaa Missä mutsi pitää korujaan He luulivat jo selvinneensä Kun Laura näkee peileistänsä Kuinka valot siniset välähtää Vaatien pysähtymään Laura kääntää kahvaa huutaen "Pidä kiinni, Petri Ruusunen!" Aamulla lööpit hehkuttaa Ja hetken he ovat legendaa

Chorus

Maailma matkaa radallaan Päivä nousee uudestaan Ei mikään muutu milloinkaan Kaikki säilyy ennallaan Samat tuulet puhaltaa Samat sateet lankeaa Ja kaikki kaunis katoaa Kaikki kuolee aikanaan
lyrics.translatedContent:
Verse (Translated)

The night cools down in the park Pete jumps to keep warm Looking at his watch and swearing He lights his last cigarette He was top of his class Now sixteen, hooked on heroin His mother can't be bothered to care He hasn't even seen his father Pete takes care of himself He got a message from his friend yesterday "I know how to get easy money If you're with me, let's meet at the park" Pete pulls up his collar And takes the last drags from his cigarette One last time, he thinks "There's nothing to lose"

Chorus (Translated)

The world keeps moving on its track The sun will rise again Nothing will ever change Everything will stay as it is The same winds will blow The same rains will fall And everything beautiful will disappear Everything dies at some point

Verse (Translated)

Laura is a young and beautiful woman After studying business Decided to start up her own company Took out a big loan from her bank But Laura got in trouble The company was forced into bankruptcy Now she can't keep up with her bills Without even talking about the loans Her parents would have the money But they don't want to help out their daughter They say, "welcome to the real world - you have to survive here yourself" Laura spends her nights lying awake praying God help me, I won't make it

Chorus (Translated)

The world keeps moving on its track The sun will rise again Nothing will ever change Everything will stay as it is The same winds will blow The same rains will fall And everything beautiful will disappear Everything dies at some point

Verse (Translated)

Laura arrives with her motorcycle Parks it at the edge of the park Pete sits in the back Neither one says a word They drive into the yard of a villa Laura hands over the keys And reminds Pete Where her mother keeps her jewelry They thought they had survived When Laura sees in her mirror The strobing blue lights of a police van Demanding them to stop Laura turns the throttle yelling "Hold tight, Petri Ruusunen!" In the morning, the headlines blaze And for a moment, they're legends

Chorus (Translated)

The world keeps moving on its track The sun will rise again Nothing will ever change Everything will stay as it is The same winds will blow The same rains will fall And everything beautiful will disappear Everything dies at some point
lyrics.writtenBy: Risto Eskolin, Anssi Matias Kela, Heikki Viljami Rinkinen
